lead_paragraph: To the Editor: In his Feb. 27 letter lamenting California's execution of William G. Bonin, the so-called Freeway Killer, the Rev. Matthew R. Regan states that the execution is "like the crimes of Mr. Bonin." Mr. Bonin didn't give his victims a trial by their peers or multiple appeals before summarily killing them; his execution is in no way comparable. And had he been discovered, tried and executed upon his first murder, he could not have killed again.
